result.execSummary:
The defendant Deparis Martice Hardin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders that all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges are hereby waived due to the significant period of time the defendant was in custody.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deparis Martice Hardin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deparis Martice Hardin in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Nick Heitman for Sarah McNutt for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made.  The defendant has served 269 days in custody.   The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 90 days time served.  THE COURT ORDERS THAT ALL COSTS FEES ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES ARE HEREBY WAIVED DUE TO THE SIGNIFICANT PERIOD OF TIME THE DEFENDANT WAS IN CUSTODY.
CR-233 filed.

Defendant Deparis Martice Hardin in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Deparis Martice Hardin in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter was put over from yesterday for a trial today.  Defendant has accepted state's offer.
AS to count 1: REPEATER enhancer is deleted.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
AS to count 2, court orders dismissed and read in.
Case is adjourned to 11-6-2015 at 8:15am for sentencing.  Defendant is remanded.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Deparis Martice Hardin in court (bull pen). Attorney Andrew Michael Meetz in court.  Defendant Deparis Martice Hardin in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in trial.  Jury trial scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Deparis Martice Hardin in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Deparis Martice Hardin in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties request that the case remains scheduled for jury trial on 10/12/2015. Negotiations placed on the record.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.
letter from the defendant received and filed.

Attorney Andrew Michael Meetz in court, defendant Deparis Martice Hardin not in court, in custody at MSDF.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.BRANCH 38 NOT IN SESSION THIS DATE.   Case set for final pretrial on 9-9-2015 at 1:30pm.  Jury trial set for 10-12-2015 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 08:16 am.
with all previous conditions continued.   mld

Defendant Deparis Martice Hardin in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Deparis Martice Hardin in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case recalled.  Court heard and granted the motion of the State to Admit 911 tape.  Due to three trials now calendared for trial today's date and the congestion of the court calendar, Court ordered Jury Trial adjourned to Branch 4 on 8-31-2015 at 8:30 am.  Defendant is currently on a Revocation hold.  Court ordered cash bond converted to a signature bond in the amount of $1,000.00.   mld

Attorney Andrew Michael Meetz in court, defendant Deparis Martice Hardin not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim is not present in court.  The State could proceed to trial, if motion to admit 911 call is granted by the Court.  The Court to review 911 tape.  Case passed.   mld

Attorney Andrew Michael Meetz in court, defendant Deparis Martice Hardin not in court, in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case remains calendred for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 5-4-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Deparis Martice Hardin in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Deparis Martice Hardin in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Dustin Frank.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss heard and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  All available discovery, offer letter and demand for discovery turned over to defense counsel, per the State.  Case is adjourned for FInal Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 4-13-2015 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 5-4-2015 at 8:30 am.  mld
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SAMANTHA P.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Deparis Martice Hardin in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Deparis Martice Hardin in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT 1.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 4.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
